etymology.description: 阝(阝) (fù, 'mound') as semantic indicator, suggesting an enclosed space, + 完(完) (wán, 'finish') as phonetic component -> courtyard or institution
etymology.interpretation: The combination of an enclosure or area marked by 阝(阝) (fù, 'mound') and the phonetic 完(完) (wán, 'finish') conveys the idea of a contained, completed area, such as a courtyard or institution.

examples.chinese: 他走进院(他走進院)，眺望院外风景(眺望院外風景)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǒu jìn yuàn, tiào wàng yuàn wài fēng jǐng.
examples.english: He walks into the courtyard and gazes at the scenery outside.

examples.chinese: 书院承载着古人的智慧(書院承載著古人的智慧)。
examples.pinyin: Shūyuàn chéngzài zhe gǔrén de zhìhuì.
examples.english: The academy embodies the wisdom of the ancients.

examples.chinese: 他在剧院(他在劇院)，欣赏精彩的表演(欣賞精彩的表演)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài jùyuàn, xīnshǎng jīngcǎi de biǎoyǎn.
examples.english: He enjoys a splendid performance at the theater.
